data.prayer: Father, help the 272 believers in Kodarma to be spiritually intentional with their relationships among their 24,429 lost friends and neighbors.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Kodarma, Jharkhand, India

data.prayer: Father, please send teachers of your Word in Kodarma who can speak your gospel boldly and clearly.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 90 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Jesus, please send your Spirit to Kodarma, so they can have freedom.
data.verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

data.prayer: Spirit, guide every search on Google for truth in Kodarma, Jharkhand, India to find a gospel video.
data.verse: you will seek Me and find Me when you search for Me with all your heart.

data.prayer: Father, I pray that the Kawar people will not be afraid or ashamed. Prevent them from being confounded or disappointed in their search for you. May the Kawar people know you.
Spirit, fill the 272 believers in the county of Kodarma with tears, because God is not obeyed by those around them.
data.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, for your law is not obeyed.

data.prayer: Father, for those with enemies and who are afraid in Kodarma, call them into your shelter and safety today.
data.verse: For you have been a refuge for me, a strong tower from the enemy.

data.section_summary:
the county of Kodarma, Jharkhand, India has a population of 24,700.

We estimate Kodarma has 272 people who might know Jesus, 300 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 24,129 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 90 neighbors who need Jesus.

data.prayer: Please, teach the 272 believers in Kodarma, Jharkhand, India how to pray to you and how to listen for your voice. That they might follow you into the good works you have prepared for them.
data.verse: My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.

location.name: Kodarma
location.people_groups_list: Khadura, Sauntia, Beldar Laria (Hindu traditions), Sardar (Muslim traditions), Mundari
